answers.answer: The positive result on the antithyroid antibodies does mean that it is autoimmune.  It sounds like you have Hashi's.  Once we have one autoimmune disease, we are more likely than the general population to get a second, third., etc.Do you have the results of your most recent thyroid labs?  If so, please post them along with the reference ranges.  Ranges vary from lab to lab, so have to come from your own lab report.You may find that your fibro "goes away" once your thyroid meds are adjusted properly.  What meds are you on, and what is the dose?  Thyroid meds can shrink nodules by giving the damaged thyroid "a rest".

question: Hey Everybody,I'm usually in the MS forum, and still in limboland for that dx.  I have multiple thryroid nodules, and have the those nastly, uncomfortable biopsy's done on them, always coming back benign.( ALWAYS A GOOD THING) I know.  Then my Endocrinologist sent me for a mri for this last one they found cause they thought it was a node problem.  It wasn't, just my nodule and enlarged thyroid.He also sent me for lab work, and a specific test called Antithyroid Antibodies.  He said that it came back positive.He wants me to take this med that will hopefully shrink the nodules.  My question is, .. is this positive result mean that this is an autoimmune  disease?  I forgot to tell you that I also have Lupus.  Every time I go to the Doc they find something new.  I also have Fibro, Epstein-Barr, Diabetes, Asthma, PsuedoTumor Cerebri, and now this.Help!Thanks Guys'Sandie
title: ANTITHYROID ANTIBODIES
